There have been some creative ways that Cardiff City has tried to recreate the atmosphere of a home crowd, such as through the use of technology or other methods. 

For example, during the pandemic, some clubs have used audio recordings of fan chants and cheers to produce artificial crowd noise in empty stadiums. This artificial crowd noise is transmitted through the stadium's speakers, which can create the illusion of a crowd being present. Cardiff City has also used this technology to replicate crowd noise during their home games.

Another approach used by the club is to feature fan's pictures on giant boards in the stadium. During matches, the club has placed  "crowd face" cutouts in sight lines of TV cameras, and images of fans across seats to create the illusion of a crowd. 

Also, Cardiff City has implemented a feature on their website where fans can purchase cardboard cutouts of themselves to be placed in the stands, and the revenue is donated to charity. 

These methods may not entirely replicate the energy and passion of a live crowd, but they do show the club's commitment to engaging fans and maintaining their support during these challenging times.
